definitions.definition: A band worn around the waist to hold clothing to one's body (usually pants), hold weapons (such as a gun or sword), or serve as a decorative piece of clothing.
definitions.example: As part of the act, the fat clown's belt broke, causing his pants to fall down.

definitions.definition: A band used as a restraint for safety purposes, such as a seat belt.
definitions.example: Keep your belt fastened; this is going to be quite a bumpy ride.

definitions.definition: A band that is used in a machine to help transfer motion or power.
definitions.example: The motor had a single belt that snaked its way back and forth around a variety of wheels.

definitions.definition: Anything that resembles a belt, or that encircles or crosses like a belt; a strip or stripe.
definitions.example: a belt of trees; a belt of sand

definitions.definition: A trophy in the shape of a belt, generally awarded for martial arts.
A collection of rocky-constituted bodies (such as asteroids) which orbit a star.
One of certain girdles or zones on the surface of the planets Jupiter and Saturn, supposed to be of the nature of clouds.
A powerful blow, often made with a fist or heavy object.
definitions.example: After the bouncer gave him a solid belt to the gut, Simon had suddenly had enough of barfighting.

definitions.definition: A quick drink of liquor.
definitions.example: Care to join me in a belt of scotch?

definitions.definition: (usually capitalized) A geographical region known for a particular product, feature or demographic (Corn Belt, Bible Belt, Black Belt, Green Belt).
The part of the strike zone at the height of the batter's waist.
definitions.example: That umpire called that pitch a strike at the belt.

definitions.definition: Device that holds and feeds cartridges into a belt-fed weapon
To encircle.
definitions.example: The small town was belted by cornfields in all directions.

definitions.definition: To fasten a belt on.
definitions.example: Edgar belted himself in and turned the car's ignition.

definitions.definition: To invest (a person) with a belt as part of a formal ceremony such as knighthood.
To hit with a belt.
definitions.example: The child was misbehaving so he was belted as punishment.

definitions.definition: To scream or sing in a loud manner.
definitions.example: He belted out the national anthem.

definitions.definition: To drink quickly, often in gulps.
definitions.example: He belted down a shot of whisky.

definitions.definition: To hit someone or something.
definitions.example: The angry player belted the official across the face, and as a result was ejected from the game.

definitions.definition: To hit a pitched ball a long distance, usually for a home run.
definitions.example: He belted that pitch over the grandstand.

definitions.definition: To move very fast
